unnormalised: ## Going Viral: What's Trending in the Social Media Jungle?
normalised: ## Going Viral: What's Trending in the Social Media Jungle?

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Ever dreamt of your content becoming the next big thing, the next "Rasode mein kaun tha?" that everyone's talking about? Well, welcome to the ever-evolving world of virality, the holy grail of social media and influencer marketing!
normalised: Hey everyone! Ever dreamt of your content becoming the next big thing, the next "Rasode mein kaun tha?" that everyone's talking about? Well, welcome to the ever-evolving world of virality, the holy grail of social media and influencer marketing!

unnormalised: So, what makes something go viral these days? Honestly, there's no magic formula, but we can definitely spot some trends. Short-form video content is still king. Think Instagram Reels, TikToks – anything that can grab attention within those crucial first few seconds. Remember that hilarious dance challenge featuring "Lungi Dance" that went viral around Diwali, 2018? That’s the kind of impact we're talking about.

unnormalised: Authenticity is another big one. People are tired of overly polished, heavily edited content. They want to see the real you, the unfiltered you. Look at Bhuvan Bam, his success is all about relatable, everyday Indian life. People in Patna or Pune, they can see themselves in his characters.

unnormalised: Another trend I've noticed is the rise of micro-influencers. These guys might not have millions of followers, but they have super engaged communities who trust their opinions. Imagine a local food blogger in Delhi recommending a new chaat place near Chandni Chowk – that could drive serious business! This is particularly effective for local businesses and brands.

unnormalised: And let’s not forget about user-generated content (UGC). Encourage your audience to participate! Run contests, ask for reviews, and reshare the best stuff. Think about how Zomato leverages user reviews – it's free marketing and builds trust!

unnormalised: Don’t be afraid to experiment! Try out new formats, jump on trending audio, and partner with unexpected creators. Virality can strike at any moment, like that random video of a chaiwala from Kolkata that blew up on 05/03/2023.

unnormalised: Ultimately, remember to stay true to your brand and your audience. And don’t be afraid to get a little quirky. One last tip, be mindful of when your content drops. Posting at 14:00 hrs, might not get you the traction you are looking for. Maybe 18:00 hrs would be better?
